documents.document: The best way to find yourself is to lose yourself in the service of others. ~Mahatma Gandhi #quote
The best way to escape from a problem is to solve it. ~Alan Saporta
Talk happiness. The world is sad enough without your woe. ~Orison Swett Marden
Ability is what you’re capable of doing. Motivation determines what you do. Attitude determines how well you do it. ~Lou Holtz #quote
When you stop expecting people to be perfect, you can like them for who they are. ~Donald Miller #quote
Always have something to look forward to, someone to share it with and always try to make a difference. ~Rosemary Conley
Love is always thirsty and looking for a thirsty lover. Love and lover follow each other like day and night. ~Rumi #quote @Rumi_Quote @RumiQuotes
You can’t live your life for other people. You’ve got to do what’s right for you, even if it hurts some people you love.
If you cannot work with love but only with distaste, it is better that you should leave your work. ~Khalil Gibran #quote
In our day to day life warm-heartedness is the key factor for happiness. ~Dalai Lama #quote
Start by doing what’s necessary; then do what’s possible; and suddenly you are doing the impossible. ~St. Francis of Assisi #quote
My path has not been determined. I shall have more experiences and pass many more milestones. ~Agnetha Faltskog #quote
Why does the eye see a thing more clearly in dreams than the imagination when awake? ~Da Vinci
When you can’t sleep at night, it’s because you’re awake in someone else’s dream. ~Marilyn Monroe #quote
The things always happen that you believe in and the belief in the thing is what makes it happen. ~Frank Lloyd Wright #quote
We are the cosmos made conscious and life is the means by which the universe understands itself. ~Brian Cox
The key is not to prioritize what’s on your schedule, but to schedule your priorities. ~Stephen Covey #quote
Age does not protect you from love. But love, to some extent, protects you from age. ~Jeanne Moreau #quote
Giving up doesn’t always mean you’re weak. Sometimes it means you are strong and smart enough to let go and move on.
If it wasn’t hard, everyone would do it. It’s the hard that makes it great. ~Tom Hanks
Knowing is not enough; we must apply. Wishing is not enough; we must do. ~Johann Von Goethe #quote
I always like to look on the optimistic side of life, but I am realistic enough to know that life is a complex matter. ~Walt Disney #quote
Men can be highly civilized only while other men, inevitably less civilized, are there to guard and feed them. ~George Orwell #quote
Anytime you stop striving to get better, you’re bound to get worse. ~Pat Riley #quote
Life is to be experienced. Put yourself out there. Do things you’ve never done. Live a life where at the end, you will have no regrets.
It doesn’t take great men to do things, but it is doing things that makes men great. ~Arnold Glasgow #quote
Instead of worrying about what people say of you, why not spend time trying to accomplish something they will admire. ~Dale Carnegie #quote
You must continue to gain expertise, but avoid thinking like an expert. ~Denis Waitley #quote
The only way on earth to multiply happiness is to divide it. ~Paul Scherber #quote
Thank you March, miss you already. Welcome April, I hope everything will be better.
To improve is to change; to be perfect is to change often.
I’ve dreamt dreams in my life that have stayed with me ever after. ~Emily Bronte #quote
If you can’t be a good example, you’ll have to be a terrible warning. ~Catherine Aird #quote
You don’t get to choose how you’re going to die. Or when. You can only decide how you’re going to live. Now! ~Joan Baez #quote
Smile, even if it’s fake. Laugh, even if you hurt. Don’t let anyone get to you, you’re beautiful regardless of what anyone says to you.
Beings are owners of their actions, heirs of actions, born of actions, related through actions, and have their actions as their arbitrator. ~Buddha #quote
When something is important enough, you do it even if the odds are not in your favor. ~Elon Musk #quote
The secret of success: stop wishing, start doing.
What is the purpose of life? I believe that the purpose of life is to be happy. ~Dalai Lama XIV #quote
There is nothing to search for; everything you seek is already within. ~Brian Thompson #quote
The best revenge is to move on and get over it. Don’t give someone the satisfaction of watching you suffer.
Justice is the crowning glory of the virtues. ~Marcus Tullius Cicero
Civil liberty is only natural liberty, modified and secured by the sanctions of civil society. ~Alexander Hamilton
The final proof of greatness lies in being able to endure criticism without resentment. ~Elbert Hubbard
God, please give us the courage to accept things for what they are, but to never lose hope that things will always get better.
If you are going to grow into a human being, you are going to need some values. ~Ann Dunham
It’s sometimes easier to ask forgiveness than it is to get permission. ~Grace Hopper #quote
I am not a product of my circumstances. I am a product of my decisions. ~Stephen Covey #quote
Learn to work harder on yourself than you do on your job. Develop new skills that will make you more valuable to the marketplace. ~Jim Rohn #quote
Be the person you were born to be, not the person you have learned to be. ~David Wood #quote
Nobody gives you an education. If you want one, you have to take it. ~John Taylor Gatto #quote
The most important thing a father can do for his children, is to love their mother. ~Theodore Hesburgh
Success is knowing your purpose in life, growing to reach your maximum potential, and sowing seeds that benefit others. ~John C. Maxwell
You should never be surprised when someone treats you with respect, you should expect it.
If you're bored with life, if you don't get up every morning with a burning desire to do things - you don't have enough goals. ~Lou Holtz #quote
As you arise in the morning, think of what a precious privilege it is to be alive - to breathe, to think, to enjoy, to love. ~Marcus Aurelius
Strength does not come from physical capacity. It comes from an indomitable will. ~Mahatma Gandhi #quote
For to be free is not merely to cast off one’s chains, but to live in a way that respects &enhances the freedom of others. ~Nelson Mandela #quote
Becoming a champion is not an easy process... It is done by focusing on what it takes to get there and not on getting there. ~Nick Saban #quote
No matter how bad things get, always remember to count your blessings.
I’m not looking for the best players, I’m looking for the right ones. ~Herb Brooks
As I grow older, I pay less attention to what people say. I just watch what they do. ~Andrew Carnegie #quote
An age is called dark, not because the light fails to shine, but because people refuse to see it. ~James Michener #quote
The real friendship is like fluorescence, it shines better when everything has darken. ~Rabindranath Tagore #quote
Finish each day and be done with it. You have done what you could. Learn from it; tomorrow is a new day. ~Ralph Waldo Emerson #quote
Losing is a learning experience. It teaches you humility. It teaches you to work harder. It’s also a powerful motivator. ~Yogi Berra #quote
The way I see it, if you want the rainbow, you gotta put up with the rain. ~Dolly Parton #quote
God only gives three answers to prayer: 1. Yes! 2. Not yet. 3. I have something better in mind.
The key to success is to keep growing in all areas of life - mental, emotional, spiritual, as well as physical. ~Julius Erving #quote
Don’t compare your progress with that of others. We all need our own time to travel our own distance.
If your happiness depends on what somebody else does, I guess you do have a problem. ~Richard Bach #quote
Most of us are just about as happy as we make up our minds to be. ~Abraham Lincoln #quote
Conquer your bad habits or they will conquer you. ~Rob Gilbert #quote
Go as far as you can see; when you get there, you’ll be able to see farther. ~J. P. Morgan #quote
Worry about your character, not your reputation. Your character is who you are and your reputation is what others think you are.
Wonderful things start to happen when you dream outside of your sleep. ~Richard Wilkins
If we’re growing, we’re always going to be out of our comfort zone. ~John Maxwell
When you judge another, you do not define them, you define yourself. ~Wayne Dyer
The people who invented the Internet never would have got around to doing it if they’d had the Internet. ~Devon Brown
Rules are made for people who aren’t willing to make up their own. ~Chuck Yeager
Think left and think right and think low and think high. Oh, the thinks you can think up if only you try! ~Dr. Seuss
Be true to your work, your word, and your friend. ~Henry David Thoreau
Sometimes you have to forget what’s gone, appreciate what remains, and look forward to what’s coming next.
Perfection is not attainable, but if we chase perfection we can catch excellence. ~Vince Lombardi
You don’t inspire your teammates by showing them how amazing you are. You inspire them by showing them how amazing they are. ~Robyn Benincasa
All progress is based upon a universal innate desire on the part of every organism to live beyond its income. ~Samuel Butler
May days.. May days.. Thank you April, and welcome May. Wish you all the best with us.
God may be in the details, but the goddess is in the questions. ~Gloria Steinem #quote
Take the first step in faith. You don’t have to see the whole staircase, just take the first step. ~Martin Luther King, Jr.
The moment you’re ready to quit is usually the moment right before the miracle happens.
For attractive lips, speak words of kindness. For lovely eyes, seek out the good in people. ~Audrey Hepburn
Successful people are not gifted; they just work hard, then succeed on purpose. ~G.K. Nielson
Strength does not come from winning. Your struggles develop your strengths. ~Arnold Schwarzenegger
When we strive to become better than we are, everything around us becomes better, too. ~Paulo Coelho
Big opportunities come to those who make the most of the small ones.
Don’t exercise your freedom of speech until you have exercised your freedom of thought. ~Tim Fargo
Much of the stress that people feel doesn’t come from having too much to do. It comes from not finishing what they’ve started. ~David Allen
You don’t write because you want to say something, you write because you have something to say. ~F. Scott Fitzgerald #quote
Sometimes you have to try not to care no matter how much you do. Because there are times that you mean nothing to someone when they mean everything to you.
The good life is inspired by love and guided by knowledge. ~Bertrand Russell #quote
